description: n for which phi(prime(n)) is a perfect square.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
example: a(8)=79 because the 79th prime is 401 and phi(401) is 400 = 20^2. a(15)=595 because the 595th prime is 4357 and phi(4357) is 4356 = 66^2.
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,1600, if(issquare(eulerphi(prime(n))),print(n)))(PARI) { default(primelimit, 2*10^8); n=m=0; forprime (p=2, 2*10^8, m++; if (issquare(eulerphi(p)), write("b062325.txt", n++, " ", m); if (n==1000, break)) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 05 2009]
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 05 2001
